		<item>
		<title><![CDATA[The AI Remedy Series: Decoding the DNA of Data Deluge with NLP]]></title>
		<link>http://localhost/LTI_POC/the-ai-remedy-series-decoding-the-dna-of-data-deluge-with-nlp/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 May 2021 10:22:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/LTI_POC/?p=292</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>By:</em>&nbsp;<strong>Satyakam Mohanty</strong><strong>, Head of Leni and Mosaic Applied Intelligence, LTI</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We discussed how Natural Language Generator (NLG) accelerates the entire data-to-decision journey in my previous blog. Let’s take up Natural Language Processing (NLP) and how it, plays a key role in the interaction between humans and computers in natural language.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Recorded mayhem</strong><br>Believe it or not, 2.5 quintillion bytes of data is generated each day. A leading contributor to this ocean of data is the Pharma and Healthcare industry, thanks to medical records getting digitized every second. This data is gathered from personal fitness trackers, medical smart devices, new research studies, government reports and health records generated every day.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>With&nbsp;<a href="https://www.lntinfotech.com/digital-transformation/data-analytics/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">big data analytics</a>&nbsp;and AI, the healthcare data of today and tomorrow can power and transform decision-making. But there are challenges along the way, one of them being data residing in a variety of unstructured formats. These include electronic health records, doctor’s notes, readings from wearable devices, research studies etc., which might not be compatible with each other. This versatility of data is a big hindrance when it comes to adopting big data because of its size and complexities.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>NLP to the rescue</strong><br>The Pharma industry is deluged with unstructured data. NLP can facilitate the extraction of data from diverse formats, sources and language to a common one. NLP works great in these scenarios because it facilitates seamless interaction between computers and humans using natural language.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Here’s how NLP can help maximize utilization of healthcare data:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Healthier documentation</strong><br>Healthcare practitioners record vast amounts of data. NLP algorithms can enable healthcare staff to record and store general notes and observations in standard formats, which can easily be processed. This can also help them deliver greater value to patients by generating an automated and customized sets of educational materials and guidelines at the time of discharge.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Automation treatment of medical records</strong><br>Hospitals could run natural language processing algorithms against unstructured data in Electronic Medical Records (EMRs). This process would automatically extract features or risk factors from the notes and also automatically store medical records.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Identifying risk factors</strong><br>Unstructured patient data can provide a goldmine of information and generate deep insights about the patient’s condition. Like, is the patient depressed? What are the patient’s living conditions? Are they homeless? Such crucial data gets buried in unstructured data formats. These can help healthcare providers to extract and identify patients who have a higher risk factor and provide them with targeted treatment programs.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Improving patient health literacy</strong><br>NLP-based IT tools can help process electronic health records and integrate the results in simplified formats for a layperson. This information can be shared with patients through a portal for better understanding of their illness.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>So, in these ways NLP combined with AI and machine learning can be a treasure trove for pharma companies. It can help them go beyond scratching the surface, to deriving actionable insights and accelerating innovation to stay ahead of competition.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><strong>Smart solutions</strong><br>In this riveting blog series I uncover the various facets of the role played by AI &amp;&nbsp;<a href="https://www.lntinfotech.com/industries/life-sciences/data-analytics-in-life-sciences/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">Analytics in the life sciences</a>&nbsp;&amp; pharma industry.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[We discussed how Natural Language Generator (NLG) accelerates the entire data-to-decision journey in my previous blog. Let’s take up Natural Language Processing (NLP) and how it, plays a key role in the interaction between humans and computers…]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

		</wp:postmeta>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Top 5 Intelligent Automation Areas for Capital Markets]]></title>
		<link>http://localhost/LTI_POC/top-5-intelligent-automation-areas-for-capital-markets/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 May 2021 10:23:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://localhost/LTI_POC/?p=294</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p><em>By:</em>&nbsp;<strong>Omar Siddiqui</strong><strong>, Sr. Business Development Executive, Intelligent Automation, LTI</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>The capital market industry is going through foundational changes, wherein firms are adapting to the digital shift and trying to evolve with the entry of FinTech companies. In the recent past, FinTech companies have been able to dramatically change the market share composition in the retail financial services with their innovative, cost-effective and technology-focused solutions. Since the entry barriers in capital market remain high, the capital market industry can make use of this opportunity to collaborate with the FinTech companies to accelerate their digital shift and develop innovative solutions.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Today, the industry faces multitude of challenges in complex changing regulatory compliances, large applications with large data volumes for reconciliations, frequent high capex for system / application upgrades, etc. As per a recent report by&nbsp;<a href="https://www.thebanker.com/Banker-Data/Bank-Trends/Banks-spend-billions-in-annual-capital-markets-compliance?ct=true" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">Association for Financial Markets in Europe</a>, regulatory compliance cost of top 13 banks is over USD 37 billion and compliance cost is 40% of the total capital market expense.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>We list down some of the areas in Capital Markets where Intelligent Automation (combination of different digital technologies like&nbsp;<a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="https://www.lntinfotech.com/digital-transformation/intelligent-rpa/" target="_blank">RPA</a>, AI &amp; cognitive) can bring a significant change and create a lasting beneficial business impact. These areas include:<br></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list {"ordered":true} -->
<ol><li><strong>Regulatory Compliance</strong>: Government requirements for KYC, AML and FACTA regulatory compliances require firms to collect, input and process the client onboarding data. This can be a long drawn cumbersome process prone to errors. Automating the KYC, AML &amp; FACTA end-to-end process with IA can speed up the onboarding, make available useful insights and significantly improve the overall customer experience.</li><li><strong>Customer Relationship Management (CRM)</strong>: More and more customers are now directly interacting with the digital systems, which give the organization a lot of opportunities through multiple touchpoints to better understand their customers and improve the overall customer experience. They can also be deployed on popular CRM tools such as Salesforce, Oracle,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.lntinfotech.com/enterprise-solutions/microsoft-dynamics/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">Microsoft Dynamics</a>, etc. Intelligent automation solutions fit perfectly in such high volume, repetitive and rule-based processes and can include processes such as account management, lead management, report generation, data-sync, automated data entry, customer contract management, etc.</li><li><strong>Corporate Actions</strong>: Intelligent automation can help in data extraction of corporate action announcements by using multiple automation levers together such as RPA, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, etc. These Can be used to automate a variety of sub-processes like counterparty notifications, dividend distribution, interest payments, eligibility &amp; entitlement calculation, etc.</li><li><strong>Post Trade Operations</strong>: It is one of the most crucial and important components of a trade lifecycle. Post execution of trade from the buyer – seller side, these must be matched, verified to ensure no error or data duplication occurs. Post trade operations include various processes in its lifecycle such as confirmation, payments &amp; settlement, asset servicing, reconciliation, order reporting, etc. Leveraging intelligent automation here can streamline the operations significantly and reduce the back-office operational costs.</li><li><strong>Robo Advisors</strong>: They are disrupting the online financial advisory services industry. These digital assistants can perform the work of financial advisors in the investing process by collecting information about an investor’s financial goals, risk appetite, investment timeframe to suggest financial plans, portfolio allocation, etc. These chatbots backed by conversational AI utilize big data and machine learning to understand their investor profiles, manage risks and ensure regulatory compliances. These robo advisors can be deployed for different roles such as investment advisory, portfolio analysis, wealth management and risk assessment.</li></ol>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p>Therefore, as we see, these emerging Intelligent Automation focused trends will act as a force multiplier for the industry’s bright future and inculcate a shift towards more innovation-focused initiatives. Another important aspect is the much-needed collaboration between the capital markets industry and FinTech companies, which will greatly enhance this innovation-led digital shift. Thus, as the industry evolves, intelligent automation technologies will come to form the cornerstone for every phase of the evolution strategy.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[The capital market industry is going through foundational changes, wherein firms are adapting to the digital shift and trying to evolve with the entry of FinTech companies. In the recent past, FinTech companies have been able to dramatically…]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title><![CDATA[COVID-19 Impact Series: Healthcare transformation leveraging IT innovation]]></title>
		<link>http://localhost/LTI_POC/covid-19-impact-series-healthcare-transformation-leveraging-it-innovation/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 May 2021 05:39:45 +0000</pubDate>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
